abstract: Food and Drug Administration concludes that laboratory-developed tests not meeting FDA requirements for accuracy are responsible for putting tens of thousands of people on unneeded drugs, raising medical costs and prompting abortions or unnecessary surgeries; Pres Obama and members of Congress are currently working on ways to set stricter standards for certain tests used to diagnose and treat range of serious problems without FDA approval.
lead_paragraph: With the use of tests booming, the administration wants new regulatory powers, and even Republicans in Congress are looking at stricter standards.

headline.main: F.D.A. Targets Inaccurate Medical Tests, Citing Dangers and Costs
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Cites Dangers and Costs of Inaccurate Medical Tests

snippet: With the use of tests booming, the administration wants new regulatory powers, and even Republicans in Congress are looking at stricter standards.
